DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study compare improvement subject-reported clinical outcome , Regenexx SD treatment v . Exercise Therapy non-retracted supraspinatus tendon tear , baseline 3 month , continue evaluation efficacy durability 24 month . Secondary objective include evaluation US evidence tendon repair ; incidence post-operative complication , adverse event , re-injections , surgical intervention ; change pain score use pain medication .
DOC.brief_title: Regenexx™ SD Versus Exercise Therapy Rotator Cuff Tears
DOC.detailed_description: Prospective , randomize , control include 25 subject treat Regenexx SD 25 subject treat Exercise Therapy alone . Subjects non-retracted supraspinatus tendon tear comprise least one half tendon thickness anterior-posterior and/or superior-inferior plane evidence positive diagnostic imaging arthrogram , ultrasound and/or MR . Subjects enrol within 60 day prior Regenexx-SD injection initiation exercise therapy take part follow-up visit two year follow treatment . A preoperative visit occur time enrollment ; follow-up visit occur clinical site 6 week , 3 month , 6 month , 12 month , 24 month post injection . Target enrollment 50 subject , include 25 subject treat Regenexx SD 25 subject treat exercise therapy alone . The primary endpoint analysis conduct subject reach 3 month endpoint . At point , subject enrol Exercise Therapy group give option cross Regenexx SD treatment group . Subjects continue follow 2 year endpoint data analysis perform 1 year 2 year time point . Subjects complete study follow 2 year follow-up visit .
DOC.criteria: Physical examination consistent Rotator Cuff tear Unremitting pain affect shoulder least 3 month Significant functional disability relate pain , lack strength , shoulder symptom Positive diagnostic imaging , may include arthrogram , ultrasound and/or MR , affect shoulder indicating nonretracted supraspinatus tendon tear comprise least one half tendon thickness anteriorposterior and/or superiorinferior plane Reasonable movement nontreated arm , define shoulder elevation equal 90° , able perform ( postinjection ) exercise Is independent , ambulatory , comply postoperative evaluation visit A massive rotator cuff tear demonstrate Grade 3 less muscle strength test internal external rotation affect shoulder Previous surgery affect shoulder Concomitant tear multiple rotator cuff biceps tendon Grade 2 great SLAP tear Type 3 acromion Significant bone spur subacromial space Inflammatory autoimmune base joint disease upper extremity pathology ( e.g. , rheumatoid arthritis , systemic lupus erythematosus , psoriatic arthritis , polymyalgia , polymyositis , gout pseudogout ) Quinolone Statin induce myopathy/ tendinopathy KellgrenLawrence grade 2 great glenohumeral osteoarthritis Adhesive capsulitis ( mild severe ) Symptomatic cervical spine pathology ( e.g . radicular cervical pain ) Severe neurogenic inflammation cutaneous nerve shoulder Shoulder instability require surgical stabilization Contraindications MRI Tested positive treat malignancy past suspected malignancy currently undergo radiation chemotherapy treatment malignancy anywhere body , whether adjacent distant propose injection site Condition represent worker 's compensation case Currently involve healthrelated litigation procedure Is pregnant Bleeding disorder Currently take anticoagulant immunosuppressive medication Use chronic opioid
